title: La France Insoumise - Wikipedia
snippet: La France Insoumise (LFI or FI; [la fʁɑ̃s ɛ̃sumiz], lit. 'France Unbowed' or 'France in Revolt') is a left-wing political party in France. It was launched in 2016 by Jean-Luc Mélenchon, then a Member of the European Parliament (MEP) and former co-president of the Left Party (PG).

title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon - Wikipedia
snippet: In February 2016, Mélenchon founded La France Insoumise. He stood as a candidate in the 2017 French presidential election, again coming in fourth, with 19.6% of the first-round vote.

title: La France Insoumise – The Left
snippet: La France insoumise is a political movement founded in 2016 by Jean-Luc Mélenchon. Action-oriented, open, popular, humanist and inclusive, it places ecosocialism at the heart of its project.

title: La France Insoumise | Encyclopedia MDPI
snippet: La France Insoumise (pronounced [la fʁɑ̃s ɛ̃sumiz]; variously translated as "Unbowed France", "Unsubmissive France", or "Rebellious France") is a democratic socialist, left-wing populist political party in France , launched on 10 February 2016 ...

title: Founder of French far-left opposition party La France Insoumise (France Unbowed-LFI) Jean-Luc Melenchon attends a press conference, in Paris | Reuters Connect
